# The `DiagnosticInfo` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

This is the base abstract class for diagnostic reporting in the backend. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Description {#details}

This is the base abstract class for diagnostic reporting in the backend.

The print method must be overloaded by the subclasses to print a user-friendly message in the client of the backend (let us call it a frontend).

Definition at line 112 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/diagnosticinfo-h">DiagnosticInfo.h</a>.

### print() {#afe1ba88d90b63845116236a764a670a3}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>virtual void llvm::DiagnosticInfo::print (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/diagnosticprinter">DiagnosticPrinter</a> &amp; DP) const</>}>
Print using the given <code>DP</code> a user-friendly message.

This is the default message that will be printed to the user. It is used when the frontend does not directly take advantage of the information contained in fields of the subclasses. The printed message must not end with &#39;.&#39; nor start with a severity keyword.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/diagnosticinfo-h/#l00135">135</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/diagnosticinfo-h">DiagnosticInfo.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>
